docs.lead_paragraph: I resent the guilt trip laced behind the Ethicist's advice to ''find another way to do your fair share for the health-care community of which you are a member and from which you benefit'' (April 15). Because I do not wish to have residents or interns present during my examination does not mean I haven't done my fair share by paying my (staggering) medical-insurance premiums or by waiting for what often is an interminable amount of time for my appointment.
docs.abstract: D J Listort letter contends time with doctor is precious and does not want intrusion of intern (Apr 15 article)

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''OSHA Leaves Worker Safety Largely in Hands of Industry'' (front page, April 25) demonstrates how the voluntary compliance approach favored by business interests and put into effect by the Bush administration fails to protect workers' safety and health. Labor's movement for safety and health rights was inspired by the civil rights movement of the 1960s and culminated in the passage of the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970. For the first time in American history, workers had the right to resist unsafe working conditions, to have OSHA inspect their workplace and to know if the materials they were working with violated OSHA safety standards.
docs.abstract: Five letters respond to April 25 Loosening the Rules series article on OSHA's slow response to life-threatening lung disease affecting workers at Missouri popcorn plant; Vernon Mogensen says article shows failure of Bush administration's voluntary compliance approach; Deane Smith says OSHA devotes portion of its resources to consulting, reducing personnel available for safety standards enforcement; Earl P Bell says regulatory agencies have been 'defanged'; Claudia Monpere McIsaac says response would be faster if business executives were getting sick; Joel Shufro, executive director of New York Committee for Occupational Safety and Health, says business industry has been fighting to weaken OSHA since its inception in 1970; drawing
